= Profile Privacy Toggles Documentation
:icons: font
:sectnums:
:toc: left
:toclevels: 2

== Overview
This document explains how each privacy toggle in the *User Profile Settings* should behave.  
The goal is to ensure both developers and testers understand the intended functionality, maintaining consistency across the frontend, backend, and user experience.

== Privacy Toggles and Their Behaviors

[cols="1,2,2,2", options="header"]
|===
| Toggle Name | Description | When Enabled (ON) | When Disabled (OFF)

| *Show Achievements*
| Controls visibility of the user's unlocked badges and achievements.
| Achievements are visible on the user's public profile.
| Achievements are hidden from all other users.

| *Show Email*
| Determines whether the user’s email address is displayed on their profile.
| Email is visible only to approved friends or teammates.
| Email remains private and hidden to everyone.

| *Allow Messages*
| Defines if other users can send private messages to this user.
| Direct messages are enabled and can be received.
| The “Message” button is hidden and users cannot send DMs.

| *Show Online Status*
| Controls whether the user appears “Online” or “Offline” to others.
| Real-time online status is displayed.
| User always appears as “Offline”.

| *Show Recent Activity*
| Manages visibility of the user’s recent tournaments, matches, or achievements.
| Activity feed is visible to others.
| Activity feed is hidden from the public profile.
|===

== Notes
* All privacy settings should be stored as **boolean flags** (`true` / `false`) in the user profile data model.
* Default configuration for new users:
** *Show Achievements:* ON  
** *Show Email:* OFF  
** *Allow Messages:* ON  
** *Show Online Status:* ON  
** *Show Recent Activity:* ON
* These settings can be toggled at any time through the *Profile Settings* page.
